member.name: SYNCMGR_HANDLER_CAPABILITIES
member.summary: Specifies the capabilities of a handler regarding the actions that can be performed against it.

member.name: SYNCMGR_HANDLER_CAPABILITIES.SYNCMGR_HCM_PROVIDES_ICON
member.summary: The handler returns a valid object from when that method is called with the SYNCMGR_OBJECTID_Icon flag. The object returned from ISyncMgrHandler.GetObject must implement . Generally, this value should not be returned if possible.

member.name: SYNCMGR_HANDLER_CAPABILITIES.SYNCMGR_HCM_EVENT_STORE
member.summary: The handler returns a valid object from when that method is called with the SYNCMGR_OBJECTID_EventStore flag. The object returned from ISyncMgrHandler.GetObject must implement .

member.name: SYNCMGR_HANDLER_CAPABILITIES.SYNCMGR_HCM_CONFLICT_STORE
member.summary: The handler returns a valid object from when that method is called with the SYNCMGR_OBJECTID_ConflictStore flag. The object returned from ISyncMgrHandler.GetObject must implement .

member.name: SYNCMGR_HANDLER_CAPABILITIES.SYNCMGR_HCM_SUPPORTS_CONCURRENT_SESSIONS
member.summary: If a handler sets this flag in the mask returned from the handler's method, it indicates that the handler plans to create multiple simultaneous synchronization sessions using . This is useful for handlers that implement a background synchronization architecture in which the handler simply signals another process to perform the synchronization rather than performing the synchronization in its method directly. This allows synchronization engines to report progress, conflicts, and events (through ) when synchronization requests come from sources other than Sync Center. For example, this could be the result of a data change notification or through application-specific UI. If more than one session is synchronizing the same item, then the progress for that item will be reported as indeterminate.

member.name: SYNCMGR_HANDLER_CAPABILITIES.SYNCMGR_HCM_CAN_BROWSE_CONTENT
member.summary: The handler returns a valid object from when that method is called with the SYNCMGR_OBJECTID_BrowseContent flag. If this value is set, the Browse Content task is added to the handler's shortcut menu. The object returned from ISyncMgrHandler.GetObject must implement .

member.name: SYNCMGR_HANDLER_CAPABILITIES.SYNCMGR_HCM_CAN_SHOW_SCHEDULE
member.summary: The handler returns a valid object from when that method is called with the SYNCMGR_OBJECTID_ShowSchedule flag. If this value is set, the Show Schedule task is added to the handler's shortcut menu. The object returned from ISyncMgrHandler.GetObject must implement . This value is used by .

member.summary: The handler returns a valid object from when that method is called with the SYNCMGR_OBJECTID_QueryBeforeActivate flag. The object returned from ISyncMgrHandler.GetObject must implement .

member.summary: The handler returns a valid object from when that method is called with the SYNCMGR_OBJECTID_QueryBeforeDeactivate flag. The object returned from ISyncMgrHandler.GetObject must implement .

member.summary: The handler returns a valid object from when that method is called with the SYNCMGR_OBJECTID_QueryBeforeEnable flag. The object returned from ISyncMgrHandler.GetObject must implement .

member.summary: The handler returns a valid object from when that method is called with the SYNCMGR_OBJECTID_QueryBeforeDisable flag. The object returned from ISyncMgrHandler.GetObject must implement .

member.name: SYNCMGR_HANDLER_CAPABILITIES.SYNCMGR_HCM_VALID_MASK
member.summary: A mask used to determine valid flags. Compare against the value retrieved by to verify valid results.
